intro: Gilia concinna, commonly known as the common gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas, often along roadsides and in sandy soils. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is annual, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
